register.description: This register contains the hard coded RTL revision number.

bitfield.description: IP revision[7:4] Major revision . [3:0] Minor revision . Example: 0x10 for 1.0, 0x21 for 2.1 .

register.description: This register allows control of various parameters of the module interface. It is not sensitive to software reset.

bitfield.description: Clocks activity during wake up mode period

bitenum.description: Interface and Functional clocks may be switched off.
Interface clock is maintained. Functional clock may be switched off.
Functional clock is maintained. Interface clock may be switched off.
Interface and Functional clocks are maintained.

If an idle request is detected, the McSPI acknowledges it unconditionally and goes in Inactive mode. Interrupt, DMA requests and wake up lines are unconditionally de-asserted and the module wake-up capability is deactivated even if the bit[ ENAWAKEUP] is set.
If an idle request is detected, the request is ignored and the module does not switch to wake up mode and keeps on behaving normally.
If an idle request is detected, the module will switch to wake up mode based on its internal activity and the wake up capability can be used if the bit[ENAWAKEUP] is set.
Trigger a module reset. This bit is automatically reset by hardware.
Automatic interface clock gating strategy is applied, based on the module interface activity

register.description: This register provides status information about the module excluding the interrupt status information

bitfield.description: Reserved for module specific status information.Read returns 0 .

register.description: The interrupt status regroups all the status of the module internal events that can generate an interrupt

bitfield.description: End of word count event when a channel is enabled using the FIFO buffer and the channel had sent the number of SPI word defined by MCSPI_XFERLEVEL[31:16] WCNT bit field.
Wake-up event in slave mode when an active control signal is detected on the spim_csx line programmed in theMCSPI_CHxCONF[SPIENSLV] field (where x=0 only)
MCSPI_RX3 register is full (only when channel 3 is enabled)
MCSPI_TX3 register underflow (only when channel 3 is enabled)
MCSPI_TX3 register is empty (only when channel 3 is enabled)
MCSPI_RX2 register full (only when channel 2 is enabled)
MCSPI_TX2 register underflow (only when channel 2 is enabled)
MCSPI_TX2 register empty (only when channel 2 is enabled)
MCSPI_RX1 register full (only when channel 1 is enabled)
MCSPI_TX1 register underflow (only when channel 1 is enabled)
MCSPI_TX1 register empty (only when channel 1 is enabled)
MCSPI_RX0 register overflow (only in slave mode)
MCSPI_RX0 register full (only when channel 0 is enabled)
MCSPI_TX0 register underflow (only when channel 0 is enabled)
MCSPI_TX0 register empty (only when channel 0 is enabled)

register.description: This register allows to enable/disable the module internal sources of interrupt, on an event-by-event basis.

bitfield.description: End of Word count Interrupt Enable.
Wake-up event interrupt enable in slave mode when an active control signal is detected on the spim_csx line programmed in theMCSPI_CHxCONF[SPIENSLV] field (where x=0 only)

register.description: The wake-up enable register allows to enable/disable the module internal sources of wake-up on event-by-event basis.

bitfield.description: Wake-up functionality in slave mode when an active control signal is detected on the spim_cs line programmed in the fieldMCSPI_CHxCONF[SPIENSLV]

bitenum.description: The event is not allowed to wake-up the system, even if the global control bit MCSPI_SYSCONF[ENAWAKEUP] is set.
The event is allowed to wake-up the system if the global control bit MCSPI_SYSCONF[ENAWAKEUP] is set.

register.description: This register is used to check the correctness of the system interconnect either internally to peripheral bus, or externally to device IO pads, when the module is configured in system test (SYSTEST) mode.

bitfield.description: Set status bitThis bit must be cleared prior attempting to clear a status bit of the MCSPI_ IRQSTATUS register. . Writing 1 into this bit sets to 1 all status bits contained in the register. .

bitenum.description: No action. Writing 0 does not clear already set status bits;
Force to 1 all status bits of MCSPI_ IRQSTATUS register.

bitfield.description: Set the direction of the spim_cs lines and spim_clk line
Set the direction of the SPIDAT[1] (spim_simo)
Set the direction of the SPIDAT[0] (spim_somi)
SWAKEUP output (signal data value of internal signal to system).The signal is driven high or low according to the value written into this register bit. .

spim_clk line (signal data value)If[SPIENDIR] = 1 (input mode direction), this bit returns the value on the spim_clk line (high or low) and a write into this bit has no effect. . If[SPIENDIR] = 0 (output mode direction), the spim_clk line is driven high or low according to the value written into this register. .

spim_somi line (signal data value)If[SPIDATDIR1] = 0 (output mode direction), the spim_somi line is driven high or low according to the value written into this register. . If[SPIDATDIR1] = 1 (input mode direction), this bit returns the value on the spim_somi line (high or low) and a write into this bit has no effect. .

spim_simo line (signal data value)If[SPIDATDIR0] = 0 (output mode direction), the spim_simo line is driven high or low according to the value written into this register. . If[SPIDATDIR0] = 1 (input mode direction), this bit returns the value on the spim_simo line (high or low) and a write into this bit has no effect. .

spim_cs3 line (signal data value)If[SPIENDIR] = 0 (output mode direction), the spim_cs3 line is driven high or low according to the value written into this register. . If[SPIENDIR] = 1 (input mode direction), this bit returns the value on the spim_cs3 line (high or low) and a write into this bit has no effect. .

spim_cs2 line (signal data value)If[SPIENDIR] = 0 (output mode direction), the spim_cs2 line is driven high or low according to the value written into this register. . If[SPIENDIR] = 1 (input mode direction), this bit returns the value on the spim_cs2 line (high or low) and a write into this bit has no effect. .

spim_cs1 line (signal data value)If[SPIENDIR] = 0 (output mode direction), the spim_cs1 line is driven high or low according to the value written into this register. . If[SPIENDIR] = 1 (input mode direction), this bit returns the value on the spim_cs1 line (high or low) and a write into this bit has no effect. .

spim_cs0 line (signal data value)If[SPIENDIR] = 0 (output mode direction), the spim_cs0 line is driven high or low according to the value written into this register. . If[SPIENDIR] = 1 (input mode direction), this bit returns the value on the spim_cs0 line (high or low) and a write into this bit has no effect. .

register.description: This register is dedicated to the configuration of the serial port interface.

bitenum.description: Master - The module generates the spim_clk and spim_cs for channel x
One or more channels will be used in master mode with automatic chip-select generation.
Only one channel will be used in master mode and the chip-select is driven by the[20] FORCE bit. This bit must be set in force spim_cs mode.

register.description: This register is dedicated to the configuration of the channel x.

bitfield.description: Clock divider granularity. This register defines the granularity of channel clock divider: power of two or one clock cycle granularity. When this bit is set, theMCSPI_CHxCTRL[15:8] EXTCLK bit field must be configured to reach a maximum of 4096 clock divider ratio. Then the clock divider ratio is a concatenation of MCSPI_CHxCONF[5:2] CLKD and EXTCLK values.

bitenum.description: Clock granularity of power of two

bitfield.description: FIFO enabled for Receive. Only one channel can have this bit field set.

bitenum.description: The buffer is not used to Receive data
The buffer is used to Receive data

bitfield.description: FIFO enabled for Transmit. Only one channel can have this bit field set.

bitenum.description: The buffer is not used to Transmit data
The buffer is used to Transmit data

bitfield.description: Chip select time controlDefines the number of interface clock cycles between CS toggling and first (or last) edge of SPI clock. .

bitenum.description: Start bit polarity is held to 0 during SPI transfer.
Start bit polarity is held to 1 during SPI transfer.

bitfield.description: Start bit enable for SPI transfer

bitenum.description: Default SPI transfer length as specified by WL bit field
Start bit D/CX added before SPI transfer. Polarity is defined by[SBPOL].

bitfield.description: Write the reset value. Read returns the reset value.
Manual spim_csx assertion to keep spim_csx for channel x active between SPI words (single channel master mode only). TheMCSPI_MODULCTRL[0] SINGLE bit must bit set to 1.

bitenum.description: Writing 0 into this bit drives the spin_csx line low for channel x when [6] EPOL = 0, and drives it high when [6] EPOL = 1.
Writing 1 into this bit drives the spim_csx line high for channel x when[E6] EPOL = 0, and drives it low when [6] EPOL = 1.
Turbo is deactivated (recommended for single SPI word transfer)
Turbo is activated to maximize the throughput for multi-SPI word transfers.

bitfield.description: DMA Read requestThe DMA Read request line is asserted when the channel is enabled and a new data is available in the receive register of the channel. . The DMA Read request line is deasserted on read completion of the receive register of the channel. .

DMA Write request.The DMA write request line is asserted when the channel is enabled and the register of the channel is empty. . The DMA write request line is deasserted on load completion of the register of the channel. .

bitenum.description: spim_csx is held high during the active state.
spim_csx is held low during the active state.

bitfield.description: Frequency divider for spim_clk (for master device only)

bitenum.description: spim_clk is held high during the active state.
spim_clk is held low during the active state.
Data are latched on odd-numbered edges of spim_clk.
Data are latched on even-numbered edges of spim_clk.

bitenum.description: Writing 0 into this bit drives the spin_csx line low for channel x when [6] EPOL = 0, and drives it high when [6] EPOL = 1.
Writing 1 into this bit drives the spim_csx line high for channel x when[E6] EPOL = 0, and drives it low when [6] EPOL = 1.
Turbo is deactivated (recommended for single SPI word transfer)
Turbo is activated to maximize the throughput for multi-SPI word transfers.

bitfield.description: DMA Read requestThe DMA Read request line is asserted when the channel is enabled and a new data is available in the receive register of the channel. . The DMA Read request line is deasserted on read completion of the receive register of the channel. .

DMA Write request.The DMA write request line is asserted when the channel is enabled and the register of the channel is empty. . The DMA write request line is deasserted on load completion of the register of the channel. .

bitenum.description: spim_csx is held high during the active state.
spim_csx is held low during the active state.

bitenum.description: spim_clk is held high during the active state.

register.description: This register provides status information about and registers of channel x.

bitfield.description: Channel x FIFO Receive Buffer Full Status

bitenum.description: FIFO Receive Buffer is not full

bitfield.description: Channel x FIFO Receive Buffer Empty Status

bitenum.description: FIFO Receive Buffer is not empty

bitfield.description: Channel x FIFO Transmit Buffer Full Status

bitenum.description: FIFO Transmit Buffer is not full

bitfield.description: Channel x FIFO Transmit Buffer Empty Status

bitenum.description: FIFO Transmit Buffer is not empty

bitfield.description: Channel x end-of-transfer status. The definitions of beginning and end of transfer vary with master versus slave and the transfer format (transmit/receive mode, turbo mode). See dedicated chapters for details.

bitenum.description: This flag is automatically cleared when the shift register is loaded with the data from the register (beginning of transfer).
This flag is automatically set to one at the end of an SPI transfer.

register.description: This register is dedicated to enable the channel x

bitfield.description: Clock ratio extension: This register is used to concatenate withMCSPI_CHxCONF[5:2] CLKD bit field for clock ratio only when granularity is one clock cycle (MCSPI_CHxCONF[28] CLKG bit set to 1). Then the max value reached is 4096 clock divider ratio.

register.description: This register is dedicated to enable the channel x

bitfield.description: Clock ratio extension: This register is used to concatenate withMCSPI_CHxCONF[5:2] CLKD bit field for clock ratio only when granularity is one clock cycle (MCSPI_CHxCONF[28] CLKG bit set to 1). Then the max value reached is 4096 clock divider ratio.

register.description: This register contains a single SPI word to transmit on the serial link, whatever SPI word length is.
This register contains a single SPI word to transmit on the serial link, whatever SPI word length is.
This register contains a single SPI word to transmit on the serial link, whatever SPI word length is.
This register contains a single SPI word to transmit on the serial link, whatever SPI word length is.
This register contains a single SPI word received through the serial link, what ever SPI word length is.
This register contains a single SPI word received through the serial link, what ever SPI word length is.
This register contains a single SPI word received through the serial link, what ever SPI word length is.
This register contains a single SPI word received through the serial link, what ever SPI word length is.
This register provides transfer levels needed while using FIFO buffer during transfer.

bitfield.description: Spi word counter: This register holds the programmable value of number of SPI word to be transferred on channel which is using the FIFO buffer. When transfer had started, a read back in this register returns the current SPI word transfer index.

Buffer Almost Full: This register holds the programmable almost full level value used to determine almost full buffer condition. If the user wants an interrupt or a DMA read request to be issued during a receive operation when the data buffer holds at least I bytes, then this bit field must be set to I-1.

Buffer Almost Empty: This register holds the programmable almost empty level value used to determine almost empty buffer condition. If the user wants an interrupt or a DMA write request to be issued during a transmit operation when the data buffer is able to receive I bytes, then this bit field must be set to I-1.
